value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:58 yo white m presents with severe headache. he also reports mild vomiting, moderate nausea, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the severe headache. a short time ago he sustained a blow to the front of the head (31 min LOC) o:Height 72 in, Weight 210 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 18, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

content2.Unmatched: a short time ago he sustained a blow
, CT Head ( - ) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive

Value.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

td.content: s:male aged 58 Ys presents for 6 days f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 31 min). he denies vomiting, headache and nausea since the accident. Furthermore, he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. he denies drinking alcohol he does not smoke o:Height 72 in, Weight 210 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 18, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=97,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.47, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: he denies drinking alcohol he does not smoke

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
